summary: "Crime and Punishment" is a famous novel by Russian author Fyodor Dostoevsky. It was published in 1866 and is about a poor ex-student named Rodion Raskolnikov who lives in Saint Petersburg. Raskolnikov plans to kill an unfair pawnbroker to take her money and help the poor. However, after the murder, he feels guilty and confused, realizing that his idea was wrong. The book follows his mental struggle and shows how crime always leads to punishment, even if it's internal. It's considered one of the best novels in world literature.
title: Crime and Punishment
